item.title: Dissertation Oral Defense
item.description: We warmly congratulate MPhil student Xin Li on the successful completion of her dissertation oral defense and graduation from the MPhil program.

item.title: Academic Seminar
item.description: PhD candidate Zhenhuan Yang presented his research at an internal Northwestern Polytechnical University seminar via an online platform. His work, preliminarily entitled “Identifying Climate Adaptation Projects in Local Government Bonds Using AI-Supported Text Analysis,” was conducted in collaboration with Siyuan FAN and Professor Yangsiyu LU. He exchanged viewpoints and discussed LLM-related topics with attending scholars.

item.title: Dissertation Oral Defense
item.description:
Congratulations to MPhil student Siyuan Fan!

Siyuan Fan, the first graduate from our EICP group, has successfully passed her dissertation oral defense. Her work was built on a solid and thought-provoking research project titled ‚ÄúIdentifying Climate Adaptation Projects in Local Government Bonds: Using AI-Supported Text Analysis.‚Äù Siyuan‚Äôs contributions have set a strong example for future students.

item.title: Academic Seminar
item.description: Professor Johannes Van Biesebroeck from KU Leuven (Belgium) was invited to give a seminar titled “Imperfect (Re)allocation in Imperfect Markets: Evidence from China‚Äôs Pilot Carbon ETS”.
